duties_responsibilities.duty: Accountable for driving sales and for the overall effective operations within the area of aquatics, reptile, bird and small companion animals.
Responsible for the welfare of all live animals and merchandise within the department.
Achieve budgeted sales goals, gross margin, animal and merchandise shrink targets, managing inventory levels, supply cost, reported budgeted expense rates and budgeted contribution.
Directly supervise all Aquatics partners and provide guidance and training to partners.
Plan and oversee participation in industry events, conferences, and trade shows to showcase services and network with potential clients.
Provide training and coaching in guest service and product knowledge to partners daily on the sales floor and on an ongoing basis.
Assist the Store Leader and/or Guest Experience Leader with location changes needed to the grid and ad planner to maximize sales.
Ensure the health, proper handling and welfare of all animals are met according to P&Ps, including completion of hourly animal check list and wellness cards.
Analyze inventory management data for the department and make recommendations for improvement.
Oversee and price all clearance merchandise for the department.
Perform all aspects of point-of-sale service, e.g. cash sales, credit and check sales, returns and exchanges.
Perform the daily balance of cash drawer as necessary.
Communicate all situations and/or conditions to the SL/GEL that affect the store.
Ensure the proper handling and documentation for all Adoption Animals.
Perform all special or other projects as assigned.
Provide quick and courteous service to all guests by utilizing the GUEST Model throughout the store.
Ensure that the store is opened and / or closed in accordance with established P&Ps.
Adhere to and promote established safety procedures.

education_certification.credential: Bachelor's degree in Retail Management, Business, or a related field (Master's preferred)
